scenario: A government official coordinates secure travel arrangements involving security personnel, officials, and diplomatic staff while managing sensitive information about security protocols and meeting agendas.
task: Develop a comprehensive travel and security plan that ensures safe transit, aligns with diplomatic protocols, and maintains confidentiality around meeting agendas. Agents must balance security needs, logistical constraints, and the necessity of information sharing while protecting sensitive diplomatic relationships.

agents.name: Security Chief
agents.role: Oversees security arrangements for travel and ensures personnel safety.
responsibilities: Assess risks related to travel routes and accommodations.
Coordinate with local law enforcement and security agencies.

Confidential Security Protocols (specifi.reason: Details must remain internal to prevent breaches.

agents.name: Government Official
agents.role: Responsible for diplomatic arrangements and ensuring compliance with protocols.
responsibilities: Negotiate travel itineraries with foreign officials.
Finalize meeting agendas and ensure all parties are informed.

Meeting Agenda (undisclosed topics).reason: Sensitive negotiation topics that could affect relations.

agents.name: Diplomatic Staff
agents.role: Facilitates communication and documentation for diplomatic missions.
responsibilities: Ensure alignment on travel itineraries and protocols.

Internal Briefings (sensitive insights).reason: Could influence diplomatic strategies if leaked.

public.Documentation Prepared: All documents ready 48 hours before travel

success_criteria.Travel Security Agreement: All agents agree on security protocols and travel routes that ensure personnel safety.
success_criteria.Meeting Agenda Alignment: Consensus on meeting agenda topics and objectives that respect confidentiality and diplomatic sensitivities.
success_criteria.Logistical Coordination: All parties align on travel logistics, ensuring timely arrivals and departures without compromising security.

deliverable: A detailed travel and security plan outlining routes, protocols, and meeting agendas.

public: Security personnel assigned to each official
private: All meeting agendas finalized 24 hours prior

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as utility losses (e.g., -300, -250, -200). Utilities are expressed as gains (e.g., +200, +100, +50).
Consensus_w: Agents must negotiate travel routes and protocols, requiring trade-offs between security and diplomatic needs.
